ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?

narratives.question_text: How would you summarize AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 for a fellow student? Would you recommend AFAM 505 01/AMST 643 01 to another student? Why or why not?
comments: I would definitely recommend this course to another student interested in translational research, especially concerning drug-based therapies. The second half of the course was especially useful as that information is unlikely to be obtained by Ph.D. student doing research or M.D. in the clinic.
IMED 680 is a wonderful course to learn about the FDA process. It was very informative while also being very interesting. I was never bored. I would absolutely recommend it.

narratives.question_text: How did this course deepen your knowledge of your discipline/profession? To what extent did this course contribute to your dissertation/research?
comments: I like the second part of the class which covers a lot of clinical trials information which is usually not covered in basic science section.
I took this course to broaden my knowledge of how drugs made it to the market. I think this could be useful if something that I work on in my research is in this position.
